title: Ticket #297: Test Cruft Code Review
description:
The clean sweep through the tests is intended to make what tests do as they run make more sense as the test runs and outputs. Its a good time to catch other issues seen with more sets of eyes. V7_3-testcruft-branch holds the changes until we merge to the trunk.

remarks:
2009-Apr-03 11:55:21 by psilord:
The first thing that needs to be done is: 

man perlstyle
man perldsc
man perlbot    # If you start using lots of perl objects

Then, we need to familiarize ourselves with the Core Modules of perl, so we don't re-implement stuff needlessly and buggily. Here are the core modules for Perl 5.8.9. It looks like we use perl 5.8.5 mainly in our test suite.

2009-Jun-19 18:53:04 by psilord:
stalled due to lack of time.

2009-Jul-30 11:40:56 by psilord:
Helped bt with definition of a system() replacement which is more amenable to our needs.

2009-Dec-01 09:59:46 by psilord:
I So far, I haven't been able to spend any time on this. The main thing which needs to happen is an overview of what we are doing in the test suite to see if some refactoring or other helper tools be written to reduce some of the complexity and increase the reliability.

2010-Feb-17 12:38:19 by psilord:
I still don't have time for this. Going to PiTS.
